title: Monsoon in India  A Climatic Lifeline Explained!

tasks.task: Follow and understand meteorological forecast and monsoon patterns.
subtasks: Listen to the forecast provided by the Indian Metallurgical Department.
Understand the South West Monsoon and its contribution to 75% of the rainfall.
Recognize the Southwest wind flow and its direction from southwest.
Identify the role of high and low pressure systems in monsoon patterns.
Distinguish between the South West and North East monsoons, noting their respective timing (June-September and October-December).
Consider the impact of landmasses on wind direction and pressure systems.

tasks.task: Assess the implications of monsoon patterns on agriculture.
subtasks: Predict the effects of Southwest Monsoon on agricultural practices in western regions.
Understand the challenges posed by wind flow direction and potential gaps in coverage.
Adjust farming strategies based on monsoon forecasts and wind patterns.
Prepare for different monsoon scenarios (Southwest vs. North East) in gardens or agricultural areas.
